Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop

Class Gumdrop

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.Gumdrop
  • public class Gumdrop
extends java.lang.Object
    Central configuration and lifecycle manager for the Gumdrop server.

    Gumdrop is a singleton that manages the core infrastructure for event-driven I/O processing: worker SelectorLoops, the AcceptSelectorLoop for TCP servers, and the scheduled timer for timeouts.

    Server Mode

    
 // Get instance with configuration
 Gumdrop gumdrop = Gumdrop.getInstance(new File("/etc/gumdroprc"));

 // Or configure programmatically
 Gumdrop gumdrop = Gumdrop.getInstance();
 gumdrop.addServer(new HTTPServer(8080));
 gumdrop.addServer(new SMTPServer(25));

 // Start processing
 gumdrop.start();

    Client Mode

    
 // Clients use getInstance() internally - no setup needed
 RedisClient client = new RedisClient("localhost", 6379);
 client.connect(handler);
 // Infrastructure auto-starts on connect, auto-stops when done

    Lifecycle

    • Infrastructure is created lazily on first getInstance() call
    • start() begins event processing
    • Auto-shutdown when no servers and no active handlers remain
    • Can restart after shutdown by calling start() again
    • JVM shutdown hook ensures cleanup
    Author:
    Chris Burdess

        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Gumdrop getInstance()
        Returns the singleton Gumdrop instance, creating it if necessary.

        This method creates a minimal instance suitable for client-only use:

        • 1 worker thread
        • No servers configured
        • No AcceptSelectorLoop (created on first addServer)

        For server mode with configuration file, use getInstance(File).

        Returns:
        the singleton Gumdrop instance

      • getInstance

        public static Gumdrop getInstance​(java.io.File gumdroprc)
        Returns the singleton Gumdrop instance, creating it if necessary.

        If a configuration file is provided, it is parsed and the instance is configured with the specified servers and worker count.

        If the configuration file is null, a minimal client-only instance is created with 1 worker thread.

        Parameters:
        gumdroprc - the configuration file, or null for client-only mode
        Returns:
        the singleton Gumdrop instance

      • addServer

        public void addServer​(Server server)
        Adds a TCP server to be managed by Gumdrop.

        If Gumdrop has already been started, the server is registered immediately and begins accepting connections. Otherwise, it will be registered when start() is called.

        Parameters:
        server - the server to add

      • removeServer

        public void removeServer​(Server server)
        Removes a TCP server from Gumdrop.

        The server stops accepting new connections immediately. Existing connections continue until they close naturally.

        If this was the last server, the AcceptSelectorLoop is shut down.

        Parameters:
        server - the server to remove

      • getServers

        public java.util.Collection<Server> getServers()
        Returns the collection of TCP servers managed by this Gumdrop instance.
        Returns:
        unmodifiable view of the servers

      • addChannelHandler

        public void addChannelHandler​(ChannelHandler handler)
        Registers an active channel handler.

        Called by clients when a connection is initiated. The handler remains registered until removeChannelHandler(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.ChannelHandler) is called.

        Parameters:
        handler - the handler to register

      • removeChannelHandler

        public void removeChannelHandler​(ChannelHandler handler)
        Deregisters an active channel handler.

        Called when a connection closes or fails. If no servers and no handlers remain, triggers automatic shutdown.

        Parameters:
        handler - the handler to deregister

      • getActiveHandlers

        public java.util.Set<ChannelHandler> getActiveHandlers()
        Returns the set of active channel handlers.

        Useful for debugging to see what's still active.

        Returns:
        unmodifiable copy of active handlers

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the Gumdrop infrastructure.

        This starts all worker SelectorLoops and the scheduled timer. If servers are registered, the AcceptSelectorLoop is also started.

        If already started, this method is a no-op.

        If no servers and no active handlers exist when start() completes, the infrastructure will shut down automatically.

        Can be called after shutdown() to restart the infrastructure.

      • isStarted

        public boolean isStarted()
        Returns whether Gumdrop has been started.
        Returns:
        true if started and not yet shut down

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Shuts down the Gumdrop infrastructure gracefully.

        After shutdown, start() can be called again to restart.

      • join

        public void join()
          throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Waits for all SelectorLoop threads to complete.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted

      • nextWorkerLoop

        public SelectorLoop nextWorkerLoop()
        Returns the next worker SelectorLoop using round-robin assignment.

        Thread-safe for use from AcceptSelectorLoop, datagram registration, and client connections that need a SelectorLoop.

        Returns:
        the next SelectorLoop in round-robin order

      • getAcceptLoop

        public AcceptSelectorLoop getAcceptLoop()
        Returns the accept loop.

        This is primarily for internal use and dynamic server registration.

        Returns:
        the AcceptSelectorLoop, or null if no servers have been added

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main entry point for running Gumdrop as a standalone server.
        Parameters:
        args - command line arguments (optional: path to gumdroprc)
